question: Question_03_(c)
statement:
Consider the discrete dynamical system

$\begin{bmatrix} a_{n+1} \\ b_{n+1} \\ c_{n+1} \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{6} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 & 2 \\ 2 & 1 & 1 \\ 3 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} a_{n} \\ b_{n} \\ c_{n} \end{bmatrix}$

which describes the evolution of the vector
$\begin{bmatrix} a & b & c \end{bmatrix}^{T}$

Find the limit of the vector
$\begin{bmatrix} a_{n} \\ b_{n} \\ c_{n} \end{bmatrix}$ as \emph{n}
tends to infinity when the initial vector is

$\begin{bmatrix} a_{0} \\ b_{0} \\ c_{0} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1  \\ 39 \end{bmatrix}$
